channel.title: investment on FinanClub
channel.description: Recent content in investment on FinanClub

item.title: TOST
item.description: score:398 Chances: The past few years have been a non-stop thrill ride for Toast (NYSE: TOST) investors. Despite the macroeconomic headwinds, Toast has continued to execute on its mandate to transform the restaurant industry with technology. You wouldn’t know it by looking at the stock price, but the business has continued to thrive, expanding its customer base, increasing sales, and paring its losses.

item.title: TGTX
item.description: score:89 Chances: TG Therapeutics stock saw a welcome improvement to its Relative Strength (RS) Rating on Thursday, rising from 87 to 93. The average of price targets set by Wall Street analysts indicates a potential upside of 127.8% in TG Therapeutics (TGTX). The company’s Q3 results were very good, with sales figures exceeding expectations.

item.title: NOK
item.description: score:344 Chances: Nokia’s disinvestment deal to offload its Device Management and Software Management business reflects the company’s strategic focus on key growth areas such as SaaS, 5G core, and Network as a Code. The acquisition of Device Management and Service Management Platform businesses by Lumine Group enhances Nokia’s software portfolio and allows Nokia to focus on investing in other strategic areas.

item.title: PINS
item.description: score:197 Chances: Pinterest (PINS) closed at $38.04 in the latest trading session, marking a +0.9% move from the prior day. Cathie Wood’s Ark Invest bought 172,894 shares of Pinterest Monday, a move that, based on the stock’s closing price of $37.70, was valued at roughly $6.
